abstract: United Nations World Food Program will make temporary 30 percent cut in rations distributed to refugees in northern Kenyan camps, third time it has had to reduce Kenyan rations since 2013, in effort to conserve dwindling supplies and funding.
lead_paragraph: The anti-hunger agency of the United Nations said the 30 percent cut, which could last for months, was designed to conserve dwindling supplies and funds.

headline.main: As Supplies Dwindle, World Food Program Cutting Rations to Refugees in Kenya
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | United Nations; Food Rations Cut for Refugees in Kenya

snippet: The anti-hunger agency of the United Nations said the 30 percent cut, which could last for months, was designed to conserve dwindling supplies and funds.
